channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Holes dug out, 23rd November
item.description:
Holes appearing in grass which leaves the area quite dangerous for small children playing. Could cause a nasty accident. This area is frequently used as a pathway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Whitehouse Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous dugout areas, 23rd November
item.description:

item.title: Road Clsed Sign obstructed, 23rd November
item.description:
The permanent Road Closed flip sign is obstructed by vegetation & a large 4x4 which is parked on the householders driveway. This sign is sited in a poor location and is easily missed by motorists who turn onto the lane. As this is the only warning sign along the lane before vehicles encounter flooding past the Red Lion Inn many miss it only to find out it’s too late when they’re in over 2ft of flood waters. The sign is in desperate need of being repositioned to a site which is more visible to motorists turning onto the lane. On the evening of 17/11/2025 numerous motorists missed seeing this sign & as there was no temporary signs deployed further along the lane at this time at least four ploughed into flood waters over 2ft deep after the river Chelt. Improvements regarding signage & depth of waters are required along the entirety of the lane. How many more motorists will miss the sign & continue along the lane, hit the flood waters before there’s a fatality?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wainlode Lane, Norton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign plate is missing (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Getting deeper by the day on the bridge over the brook, 23rd November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lilliesfield Avenue, Hucclecote, Gloucester

item.title: Extremely large puddle crossing the east lane of the A436 very dangerous doesnt take alot of rain before its right the way across the road., 23rd November
item.description:
Just past the star college entrance after the bend heading east on A436 opposite two semidetached homes on the right. The water sits on the left for about 50 yards Probably best to be looked at after or during rain to see how dangerous it is. Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A436, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sewer cover been moved causing a large gap, 23rd November
item.description:
To the side of flats 15-21 Windermere road near bungalow, noticed sewer cover including concrete has been moved exposing the sewer. Often knocked when council grass cutting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Windermere Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
